```{python}
import numpy as np
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# Age range (20 to 90 years)
age = np.linspace(20, 90, 100)

# Calculate predicted physical function based on age for each treatment
tb_effect = 48.5 - 37.2 + 0.05 * age  # Diet plus exercise
te_effect = 48.5 - 13.9 - 0.11 * age  # Exercise only
td_effect = 48.5 - 8.0 - 0.21 * age   # Diet only

# Plotting the results
plt.figure(figsize=(8, 6))
plt.plot(age, tb_effect, label="Diet + Exercise", color='b', linestyle='-', linewidth=2)
plt.plot(age, te_effect, label="Exercise Only", color='g', linestyle='--', linewidth=2)
plt.plot(age, td_effect, label="Diet Only", color='r', linestyle='-.', linewidth=2)

# Add labels and title
plt.xlabel("Age", fontsize=12)
plt.ylabel("Predicted Physical Function (Y-hat)", fontsize=12)
plt.title("Effect of Age on Physical Function by Treatment Type", fontsize=14)
plt.axhline(y=48.5, color='k', linestyle=':', label="Baseline Function")
plt.legend()
plt.grid(True)
plt.show()
```
